description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Portadown vs Linfield in the Irish Premiership
title: Irish Premiership: Watch highlights as Cooper treble sees Blues past Ports
title_page: Irish Premiership: Watch highlights as Cooper treble sees Blues past Ports - BBC Sport
maintext:
Final whistle
That is all from us on a good day for Linfield, who move 15 points clear at the top of the table as Joel Cooper's hat-trick helped them to a 3-1 win against Portadown.
Cliftonville and Crusaders got back to winning ways with victories over Loughgall and Coleraine respectively.
Carrick Rangers and Ballymena United played out a drab 0-0 draw.
The game at the Oval between Glentoran and Larne was abandoned early in the second half with the score at 0-0 following floodlight failure.
You can read the report from the games here.
We will have highlights and reaction to follow on the BBC Sport website, but for now, goodnight.
'Great day for Linfield'
FT: Portadown 1-3 Linfield
Colin Coates
Glenavon first team coach on Sportsound
Great day for Linfield, that was a tricky game on a difficult pitch, but Joel Cooper's hat-trick has them ahead, a bit of a storm came from Portadown but Linfield used their experience and saw the game out. To go 15 points clear even with games played and games not played is a huge lead and you would be very surprised if they don't go on and win the Gibson Cup.
FULL-TIME
Coleraine 0-2 Crusaders
All over at the Showgrounds where Crusaders leave with the points after a 2-0 win.
Jacob Blaney headed the visitors in front just after the half hour before second half sub' Harry Jewitt-White secured the win deep into added time.
The home side created a number of chances over the 90 minutes, hitting the woodwork twice, but were unable to find a way through an organised Crusaders backline.
